Elemental Enemies & Attacks: How Do They Interact?
Elements that are strong against another
When an element attacks an element that
it is strong against it, it will do half damage.
Light and dark are an exception.
Elemental Status Effects: Your Elemental Identity
Enemies with status effects will switch to that element for
damage calculations. Enemies that are already elemental will
have all elements in play accounted for the final calculation.
Multi-element calculations multiply together, so you can use
that to your advantage to dish out massive damage. However,
party members can be turned elemental by these status effects
When switched to another element by an elemental status effect,
same-element attacks will do half damage
Elemental Absorption: Don't Heal Your Enemy!
When an elemental enemy is hit with an attack that
matches its element, the attack will be absorbed,
Elemental states will not cause same-element
Light and Dark do not absorb themselves.
- While there is technically a Physical element, which
is just non-elemental attacks, it has no weaknesses
or strenghts against other elements. However, some
enemies might be resistant against it, or even
- When an elemental enemy is hit with an attack that
matches its element, the attack will be absorbed,
healing it. The exception to this is the pure elements.
- Light/Dark will not absorb Light/Dark attacks, and
will instead halve the incoming damage.
- Fire attacks remove Water status effects.
- Light Shield: Equippable by Knights, Clerics
As with anything, there are going to be exceptions
to these rules. However, they will hold true for
The rule of thumb is to simply check every member of
your party's equipment menu. Anything greyed out is
unusable, but if it's normal white text, you
Tap D / RIGHT ARROW when on an equipment slot to
see the current item's possible upgrades.
Tap A / LEFT ARROW when on an equipment slot to
see the current item's equipping restrictions.

Elemental Status Effects: Your Elemental Identity
Additionally, element attacks will remove elemental
status effects they are strong against.
On a final note, being switched to another element by an elemental
status effect will make the affected battler immune to afflication
of elemental status effects that the currently applied one is
resistant to. For example, being turned to fire would make a
battler immune to ice status effects.
